articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Another child died of malnutrition in northern Gaza overnight and six people were killed and several wounded in renewed Israeli bombing of residential areas of Gaza City, Palestinian health officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Girl dies of malnutrition in Gaza as Israel bombs north and south

articles.author: Phil Stewart
articles.description: The Republican lawmaker who leads the House Armed Services Committee has written to the Biden administration formally demanding it shut down its aid pier off the coast Gaza, calling the operation ineffective, risky and a waste of money.
articles.title: Exclusive: Senior US Republican demands Biden administration shut Gaza aid pier

articles.author: Ahmed Elimam, Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: Satellite images showing much of the Lebanese village of Aita al-Shaab in ruins after months of Israeli air strikes offer a glimpse of the scale of damage in one of Hezbollah's main bastions in south Lebanon.
articles.title: Israel's bombs flatten swaths of Lebanon village amid fears of wider war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: About a dozen Bolivian military officers have been arrested following Wednesday's attempted coup, a senior government minister told local television on Thursday, adding they face accusations that could lead to 15 to 30-year prison terms.
articles.title: Military officers detained in Bolivia after attempted coup, minister says

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Kenyan police put up roadblocks on streets leading to the presidential palace on Thursday as some protesters vowed to "occupy State House" despite the president's climbdown on proposed tax hikes that sparked a week of demonstrations.
articles.title: Kenya braces for fresh protests despite president's tax climbdown

articles.author: Libby George, Karin Strohecker, Aaron Ross
articles.description: Deadly Kenyan protests that scuppered tax hikes and a failed coup amid fading economic prospects in Bolivia this week are violent reminders of the dangers posed by faltering economies and punishing austerity measures.
articles.title: Kenya clashes and Bolivia's failed coup show perils of economic hardship

articles.author: Antonio Bronic
articles.description: Excavators dug through piles of waste at a garbage dump surrounded by sunflower fields in Croatia on Thursday, searching for bodies of victims killed in war more than three decades ago, after remains of 10 people were found earlier this month.
articles.title: Ten war victims found in mass grave at Croatian garbage dump, more expected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. spy chief Avril Haines will be in South Korea and meet President Yoon Suk Yeol on Friday amid rising tensions on the Korean peninsula and a recent pact between Moscow and Pyongyang pledging closer military ties, a news report said on Thursday.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon, US spy chief to discuss North Korea-Russia ties, report says

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: A defunct Russian satellite has broken up into more than 100 pieces of debris in orbit, forcing astronauts on the International Space Station to take shelter for about an hour and adding to the mass of space junk already in orbit, U.S. space agencies said.
articles.title: Russian satellite breaks up in space, forces ISS astronauts to shelter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum on Thursday named a former Mexico City official as her minister of energy in a second round of cabinet appointments set to take office with her in October.
articles.title: Mexico president-elect names energy, transportation ministers
